mentions.context: Reads were filtered using PreAssembler Filter v1 of the SMRT Portal version 2.3 (Pacific Biosciences of California, Inc.), with Minimum Subread Length 500, Minimum Polymerase Read Quality 0.80 and Minimum Polymerase Read Length 100.
Pixel quantification was done using FiJi (Schindelin et al., 2012).

MLI was performed on RGB images using the ilastik software (Berg et al., 2019), which was recently exploited in biomedical and environmental studies as well as plant symptoms assessment (Ilett et al., 2020;Ojeda-Martinez et al., 2020;Pike et al., 2020;Rashid et al., 2019).
The data and materials that support the findings of this study (ilastik training file and bacterial strains) are available from the corresponding author upon request.
Machine learning-based pixel segmentation was performed using the Pixel Classification workflow from ilastik v1.3.3 (Berg et al., 2019).
For each pixel, the maximum quantum yield of photosystem II photochemistry (Fv/Fm = (Fm-F0)/Fm) was calculated using Phenoplant (http://www.phenoplant.org)
